page.title: 02POPULATION
page.content: Until about 150 yrs ago the population was relatively small and largely rural. With the growth of {Victorian seaside holidays,}Bexhill became a resort attracting the more affluent visitor. It's still noted for it's healthy climate and longevity of inhabitants. It soon became a {retirement centre,}predominantly for the monied south Londoner. It's heyday was in the 1930s. The population in 1985 is still largely of{retirement age,}but our block also contains expanding private and council housing on the northern outskirts of town, which attract younger and less affluent families. New industrial estates in nearby Hastings and Eastboure provide some employment. Further{development}of farmland is planned by the end of the century.
